images.description: Astronaut John Glenn explains the space glove to President John F. Kennedy at the Manned Spacecraft Center. This stop was part of a presidential tour of the US space installations.
President John F. Kennedy speaks before a crowd of 35,000 people at Rice University. This stop was part of a presidential tour of the US space installations.

Astronauts Stafford, See and Conrad confer with Warren North, Chief of Flight Crew Operations (MSC) on charts of the LEM shown in a full-scale mock-up in the background at the Grumman plant in Bethpage, Long Island, New York.
Astronauts Conrad, Lovell, See and Schirra discuss the engineering and design elements of the LEM at a mock-up review meeting held at the Grumman plant in Bethpage, Long Island, New York.
LM mockup (probably TM-1 - note round forward hatch/docking port and knotted rope for descent)
Apollo astronauts learn how to walk and jump on the moon at NASA's Langley Research Center's Lunar Landing Training Facility.
astronaut descends ladder of full-scale LM mockup
astronaut and early LM mockup during EVA simulation

Apollo CSM 008 in Space Environment Lab at MSC - Astronauts Joe Kerwin, Ed Givens, and aerospace technician Joe Gagliano conducted a six day simulated mission in this block 1 spacecraft in support of the Apollo 204 (Apollo 1) mission.
another view of Apollo CSM 008 in Chamber A of Space Environment Lab Bldg. 32 at MSC
(description not yet available)

S-IVB stage originally intended for Apollo/Saturn-206 unmanned lunar module test mission is seen during mating at Complex 37.  Saturn IB 206 would not fly for six years, when the vehicle would be used for the Skylab 2 mission
Launch Escape System
aerial view of Launch Complex 34 three days following tragic Apollo 204 (Apollo 1) fire
Astronaut Frank Borman briefs Dr. Floyd Thompson and the other Apollo 204 (Apollo 1) Review Board members on the logistics of the Apollo Mission Simulator at the Kennedy Space Center.
NASA and NAA personnel are briefed on spacecraft hand-hold and "golden slipper" concepts at North American Aviation
Astronaut Don Lind practices ingress and egress of Lunar Module mock-up in Building 5 of the Manned Spacecraft Center in Houston.
Astronaut Don Lind practices ingress and egress of Lunar Module mock-up in Building 5 of the Manned Spacecraft Center in Houston.
The Apollo Command Module and Lunar Module Simulators

Apollo recovery test in the Gulf of Mexico.  Astronauts Lovell, Roosa and Duke spent 48 hrs inside CSM-007 on April 5-7, 1968 evaluating the capacity of the CM to support three astronauts waiting for a delayed recovery.
